read_quality.quality: analog reading of this sensor, please use the data as a comparative	quantity, because it is a qualitative results
read_quality.@brief@:
Get the analog reading of air quality. The air quality sensor is is designed for comprehensive
monitor over indoor air condition. It's responsive to a wide scope of harmful gases, as carbon
monixide, alcohol, acetone, thinner, formaldehyde and so on. Due to the measuring mechanism, this
sensor can not output specific data to describe target gases' concentrations quantitatively. But
it's still competent enough to be used in applications that require only qualitative results,
like auto refresher sprayers and auto air cycling systems. If exposed for a long time to pollution,
it will be damaged.

Events.encoder_position:
Report the current position when the knob idles for 100ms. The event data is the current position.
PLEASE NOTE: To use the encoder, you need either using battery to power the board or manually soldering to short R1 of Grove-Encoder. This is due to the RX pin of UART interface is pulled up to CP2102's TX pin with a 1K resister and R1 on encoder board with the value 3.3K will obstruct the encoder to correctly pull down the signal A pin.

write_enable_acceleration.@brief@: Enable or disable the acceleration feature of the step counting.

write_reset_position.@brief@: Reset the position to a specified number.

read_position.@brief@:
Read the position of the encoder. The position can be positive or negative number. The position increases when rotate clockwise and decreases when rotate anti-clockwise.

PLEASE NOTE: To use the encoder, you need either using battery to power the board or manually soldering to short R1 of Grove-Encoder. This is due to the RX pin of UART interface is pulled up to CP2102's TX pin with a 1K resister and R1 on encoder board with the value 3.3K will obstruct the encoder to correctly pull down the signal A pin.

guide inside this zip file: http://www.seeedstudio.com/wiki/images/5/52/On-Chipfirmware_for_Motor_driver.zip

write_enable_stepper_mode.speed: defines the time interval the i2C motor driver change its output to drive the stepper, the actul interval time is : motorspeed * 4ms. that is , when motor speed is 10, the interval time would be 40 ms

To drive a stepper motor, we need to change the working mode of this driver into stepper mode.
IMPORTANT: Need I2C Motor Driver hardware version >= v1.3 and manually update the firmware according to the
guide inside this zip file: http://www.seeedstudio.com/wiki/images/5/52/On-Chipfirmware_for_Motor_driver.zip
4ms. that is , when motor speed is 10, the interval time would be 40 ms

write_angle.@brief@:
Drive the servo to rotate a specified angle and hold on the servo driven PWM signal.
The PWM signal maybe polluted by other PWM API calls if the others use different frequency.
e.g. Grove - Infrared Emitter may affect the action of servo as it's using 38KHz PWM.

write_angle_motion_in_seconds.@brief@:
Drive the servo to rotate a specified angle and shut down the servo driven PWM signal in specified seconds time.
For normal servos, this API still works even if the PWM signal is off. But the servo losts the strength that holding the position.
This API will avoid the servo from the influence of other PWM modules, e.g. Grove - Infrared Emitter
